etymologies: early 16th century: from medieval Latin dictionarium (manuale) or dictionarius (liber) ‘manual or book of words’, from Latin dictio (see diction)

definitions: a book or electronic resource that lists the words of a language (typically in alphabetical order) and gives their meaning, or gives the equivalent words in a different language, often also providing information about pronunciation, origin, and usage

examples.text: I'll look up ‘love’ in the dictionary
the website gives access to an online dictionary

shortDefinitions: book or electronic resource that lists words of language and gives their meaning

definitions: a reference work on a particular subject, the items of which are typically arranged in alphabetical order
a set of words or other text strings made for use in applications such as spelling checkers

examples.text: the worm attempts to crack account passwords using a built-in dictionary

shortDefinitions: set of words or other text strings made for use in applications
